accounts.backend module¶

This module implements the login function. This is customised to allow users to login using either their email address or system_number.

class accounts.backend.CobaltBackend[source]¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.backends.ModelBackend

Custom backend to control user logins.

method to authenticate users

accounts.models module¶

Models for our definitions of a user within the system.

about¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

bbo_name¶

comment1_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

comment2_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

property full_name¶

Returns the person’s full name.

get_previous_by_date_joined(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: date_joined>, is_next=False, **kwargs)¶
groups¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

phone_regex = <django.core.validators.RegexValidator object>¶
pic¶

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

accounts.urls module¶

accounts.urls.not_found_handler(request, exception=None)[source]¶

accounts.views module¶

Handles all activities associated with user accounts.

This module handles all of the functions relating to users such as creating accounts, resetting passwords, searches. profiles etc.

accounts.views.activate(request, uidb64, token)[source]¶

User activation form

This is the link sent to the user over email. If the link is valid, then the user is logged in, otherwise they are notified that the link is not valid.

Parameters

  • - standard request object (request) –

  • - encrypted user id (uidb64) –

  • - generated token (token) –

Returns

HttpResponse

accounts.views.blurb_form_upload(request)[source]¶

Profile update sub-form. Handles the picture and about fields.

Allows a user to change their profile settings.

Parameters

- standard request object (request) –

Returns

HttpResponse

accounts.views.loggedout(request)[source]¶

Should review if this is really needed.

accounts.views.member_detail_ajax(request)[source]¶

Returns basic public info on a member

Ajax call to get basic info on a member. Will return an empty json array if the member number is invalid.

Parameters

- member number (member_id) –

Returns

member, clubs, global org name.

Return type

Json array

Allows a user to change their profile settings.

accounts.views.public_profile(request, pk)[source]¶

Public Profile form.

Shows public information about a member.

Parameters

  • - standard request object (request) –

  • - key of User (pk) –

Returns

HttpResponse

accounts.views.register(request)[source]¶

User registration form

This form allows a user to register for the system. The form includes Ajax code to look up the system number and pre-fill the first and last name.

This form also sends the email to the user to confirm the email address is valid.

Parameters

- standard request object (request) –

Returns

HttpResponse

accounts.views.search_ajax(request)[source]¶

Ajax member search function.

Used to search for members by the Member to Member transfer part of Payments. Currently very specific to payments. Could be made more generic if other parts of the system need a search function.

Parameters

  • - partial lastname to search for. Wild cards the ending. (lastname) –

  • - partial firstname to search for. Wild cards the ending. (firstname) –

Returns

HttpResponse - either a message or a list of users in HTML format.
